DataElement.preferredName: Breast Problem Past Three Month Symptom Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe a symptom experienced in the past three months related to breast disease or disorder.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved._An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

Property.preferredDefinition: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released per approval by S.Shakour. mc 8/24/11

ValueDomain.preferredName: Past Three Month Breast Symptom Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Past; before the present time._A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one._One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar.  It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Painful sensation in the breast region.: Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A feeling of mental or physical uneasiness, pain, or distress.

Concepts.definition: Painful sensation in the breast region.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A feeling of mental or physical uneasiness, pain, or distress.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The hue of the long-wave end of the visible spectrum, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 630 to 750 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue resembles that of blood: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

Concepts.definition: The hue of the long-wave end of the visible spectrum, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 630 to 750 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation and whose hue resembles that of blood
An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.
The flow of fluid from the nipple of the breast.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The pigmented projection on the surface of the breast. Ducts that conduct milk from the mammary glands to the surface of the breast exit through the nipple. (from MedTerms Medical Dictionary; medterms.com): The act of turning inside out, upside down, or end-for-end.

Concepts.definition: The pigmented protuberance on the surface of the breast through which milk is drawn from the breast.
The act of turning inside out, upside down, or end-for-end.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A chronic disorder comprising three variants which range from lesions consisting primarily of an overgrowth of fibrous tissue to those characterized by dominance of the proliferation of the epithelial parenchyma to a form of dysplasia characterized by both stromal and epithelial hyperplasia with the formation of cysts.

Concepts.definition: Fibrosis associated with cyst formation in the breast parenchyma.

PermissibleValues.value: Lump in your armpit or under your arm

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Axilla; the hollow under the arm where it is joined to the shoulder.: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells, inflammatory cells, or cystic changes.

Concepts.definition: The underside concavity where the arm and the shoulder are joined.
A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells, inflammatory cells, or cystic changes.

PermissibleValues.value: Changes in a lump or breast mass

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: alteration or modification.: A mass in the mammary gland, either mobile or immobile. Once the mass has reached the size of a small garden pea, it can be detected by palpation. With mammography a larger number of early breast cancers are being detected since this techniques allows detection prior to the point at which the mass can be felt. Breast masses are not always malignant. Benign fibrocystic breast disease is not uncommon. A fine needle biopsy aspiration can distinguish a cystic mass from a solid one.: Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells, inflammatory cells, or cystic changes.

Concepts.definition: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

A mass in the mammary gland, either mobile or immobile. Once the mass has reached the size of a small garden pea, it can be detected by palpation. With mammography a larger number of early breast cancers are being detected since this techniques allows detection prior to the point at which the mass can be felt. Breast masses are not always malignant. Benign fibrocystic breast disease is not uncommon. A fine needle biopsy aspiration can distinguish a cystic mass from a solid one.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells, inflammatory cells, or cystic changes.

With mammography a larger number of early breast cancers are being detected since this techniques allows detection prior to the point at which the mass can be felt. Breast masses are not always malignant. Benign fibrocystic breast disease is not uncommon. A fine needle biopsy aspiration can distinguish a cystic mass from a solid one.: Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells, inflammatory cells, or cystic changes.

Concepts.definition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.

A mass in the mammary gland, either mobile or immobile. Once the mass has reached the size of a small garden pea, it can be detected by palpation. With mammography a larger number of early breast cancers are being detected since this techniques allows detection prior to the point at which the mass can be felt. Breast masses are not always malignant. Benign fibrocystic breast disease is not uncommon. A fine needle biopsy aspiration can distinguish a cystic mass from a solid one.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: Before the present time.
A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
